channel.title: Projects on I.O
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on I.O

item.title: Project VI: Diabetes prediction classifier
item.description: The goal was to predict whether or not an individual is likely to have diabetes based on the features body mass index (BMI) and age (in years). Therefore, it is a binary classification problem. A target value of 0 indicates that the individual does not have diabetes, while a value of 1 indicates that the individual does have diabetes. Data was collected in excel sheets and loaded as a pandas dataframe.

item.title: Project VII: Music Popularity Prediction
item.description: Note: Scikit learn requires numeric data and no missing values. Real world data often has missing values so we will preprocess data often eg you recieve a color as your data, this makes it categorica and as scikit learn will not accept categorical, you’ll need to convert it to numerical. You can create binary features from the categories, this is abinary preprocession called Dummy Variables. Binary features from a list of music genres To create dummy variables, we can use scikit-learn: OneHotEncoder or pandas: get_dummies()

item.title: Project V: Pedagogue.ai CNN Handwriting Recognizer
item.description: Binary features from a list of music genres Coming soon

item.title: Project III: Python Web Scrapers/Data Warehouse
item.description: Python Data Scientist filerskeepers · Full-time Oct 2020 - Jul 2022 · 1 yr 10 mo Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands Here I led a solo team, had a series of brainstorming with the CEO, conceptualize business automation process and features for a key department. Developed web scrapers, extracting data from targeted websites and performing NLP filtering operations on the text on each file. developed and deployed on staging, a dashboard with email auth where team members can upload a file or series of files and readily create processed file showing better insights in the data.

item.title: Project I: Fmoh ISS
item.description: Analysis of key health indicators Built a data collection Web application for medical researchers using Django, leveraging Ona’s Open source project. Led a team of two from Idea to prototype and built a reminder tool using slack’s API for the Human Resource team. Working in a team of 3, I developed multiple unit tests for a health tech project running on Django.

item.title: Project II: Clone and Upgrade ONA data
item.description: Cloned and upgraded open source program by adding additional api endpoints, removing api end points, writing and refactoring unit tests, migrated from Django 1.1>2.2>3.0
